data.title: Spectator Guide
data.text:
Items to Bring from Home

Here are a few items we recommend you bring from home to enhance your Championship experience:

Jacket and/or layered outerwear piece

Comfortable walking shoes

Portable phone charger

Personal sunscreen

Nursing mothers may bring necessary equipment on-site. Storage and refrigeration are available at the Medical Stations at Hole 1 fairway and Hole 10 tee.

The following items are also permitted on-site:

Small bags (10x10x10)

Diaper bags and strollers

Umbrellas

Cameras (Monday - Wednesday, May 13 - 15 ONLY)

Entering the Championship Grounds at Valhalla

Spectators must enter the grounds through the scan gate corresponding with their ticket type.

Beginning Opening Day, May 13, all Championship+ Ticket holders arriving through the Main Spectator Entrance are required to enter the grounds through designated lanes. Upon entry, your mobile ticket will be scanned and you will receive a daily Championship+ wristband that becomes your means to redeem entree, snack, and non-alcoholic beverage items at all on-course concession venues.

All Valhalla Member Club, Club PGA, and PGA Premier Hospitality Ticket holders arriving through the Main Spectator Entrance are required to enter the grounds through designated lanes. Upon entry, your mobile ticket will be scanned. Wristbands for Valhalla Member Club, Club PGA, and PGA Premier Hospitality Ticket holders will be provided upon entry to their respective venues.

All Championship Volunteers and other credential holders are required to enter the grounds through designated lanes at the Main Spectator Entrance.

To learn more about the PGA Championship+ Food & Non-Alcoholic Beverage Program and how it works, click here.

Inclement Weather

Please observe the Leader Boards and Video Boards for the Weather Warning signs which will appear when inclement weather is approaching the course. When the signs appear, spectators are advised to take precautions and seek shelter prior to play being suspended. If the sirens sound, seek shelter immediately.

In the event of inclement weather, please remember to avoid the following:

Tall and/or Isolated Trees

Hilltops and High Places

Metal Fences

Telephone Poles

Open Fields

Golf Carts

Bodies of Water

Grandstands

Several grandstands are located throughout the grounds at Valhalla. All public grandstand seating is first-come, first-served. Consult the course map or the PGA Championships App to find the closest Grandstand.

UofL Health Medical Stations

First-Aid stations are staffed by medical professionals from UofL Health. These stations are located near the Main Spectator Entrance, near Hole 1 Fairway, and near Hole 10 Fairway. A dedicated Women’s Health Station for nursing mothers will be available at the Medical Stations at Hole 1 fairway and Hole 10 tee. Storage and refrigeration available. Nursing mothers are permitted to bring necessary equipment to the Championship.

Accessibility Services (ADA)

The PGA Championship is a fully accessible event, dedicated to continually improving our efforts to ensure that everyone has access to all Championship amenities. To learn more about the services provided this year, click here.

Complimentary Wi-Fi

Complimentary Wi-Fi is available throughout the Championship grounds. Keep an eye out for Wi-Fi signs during your visit and make sure to download the PGA Championships App!

Portable Phone Charging

T-Mobile for Business understands the importance of keeping fans charged up and connected at the course. Complimentary, portable phone chargers will be available to all spectators on-site. Phone charging stations can be found at the Main Entrance, 7th Green, 10th Fairway, 13th Fairway and inside Club Magenta at the 10th Tee.

Methods of Payment

The following methods of payment are accepted onsite at the PGA Championship, identified by location. All on-site transactions will be cashless. No cash or checks will be accepted.

The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire: American Express, MasterCard, VISA, Discover Card

Market Concession and Bars: American Express, MasterCard, VISA, Discover Card, Apple Pay and Google Pay

Accommodations & the Surrounding Area

Located along the Ohio River, Louisville is the largest city in Kentucky. Louisville is known for its authenticity and southern hospitality. Aside from the thrilling tournament, you can explore the city's many attractions, including bourbon distillery tours, exciting Churchill Downs races, and delicious local cuisine.

To learn more, see gotolouisville.com/2024pga/.

PGA Public Parking is complimentary and located at the Kentucky Exposition Center (937 Phillips Ln, Louisville, KY 40209). Enter through the Main Gate or Gate 6. Carpooling Is highly encouraged.

As you approach the Kentucky Exposition Center, please follow signage and traffic control to PGA Public Parking. Complimentary shuttle service is provided to and from the Main Spectator Entrance at Valhalla Golf Club. There is no public parking, drop-offs, or walk-ins at or around Valhalla Golf Club during Championship Week.

Note: There is no overnight parking in any PGA Public Parking Lots. Vehicles left overnight will be subject to towing at the owner's expense. PGA Tournament Corporation is not responsible for damage to your vehicle, or items lost or stolen from your vehicle.

The public parking lot will be open Monday, May 13 - Sunday, May 19, 2024.

Rideshare

Spectators electing to utilize UBER, Lyft, or Z-Trip must be picked up and dropped off at the PGA Championship's Official Rideshare lot located near Valhalla Golf Club. For an efficient Rideshare experience, simply enter “2024 PGA Championship” as the destination in your Rideshare app of choice and your driver will take you to the designated Rideshare lot. Spectators utilizing rideshare will enter and exit the Championship grounds through the Main Spectator Entrance, a short walk from the Official Rideshare lot.

Please be advised that the PGA Championship cannot guarantee drivers and there may be extended wait times for rideshare vehicles during peak departure hours from Valhalla Golf Club. There is no public parking, drop-offs, or walk-ins at or around Valhalla During Championship Week.

Note: No street parking allowed. Any parked vehicles left driverless on Shelbyville Road or in the Rideshare lot are subject to towing at the owner's expense. Vehicle owner operators are encouraged not to leave their vehicle parked and/or unoccupied.

Volunteer Parking (Lot V)

Volunteer parking information has been shared directly with Championship Volunteers. Please consult your Volunteer manual for directions and hours of operation.

Walk or Bike

No walking, biking, or electric scooters will be permitted on Shelbyville Road for safety purposes. There is no public parking, drop-offs, or walk-ins at or around Valhalla During Championship Week.

Accessible Parking (Lot ADA)

Designated accessible parking for those requiring lift-equipped transportation to the course will be available Monday - Sunday at the UofL Shelbyhurst Campus located at 440 N Whittington Parkway Louisville, KY 40222. You will need a verified Disabled Person Parking placard, permit, or license plate to enter this parking lot. Please follow signage on Shelbyville Road to the ADA Lot. The person to whom the placard or plate is issued must be present in the vehicle, as a driver or passenger.

Please note that it’s against the law to park in an accessible parking space without the required ADA credentials or to fraudulently use someone else's in order to gain access to ADA parking spots.

The front rows of PGA Public Parking lot will also be reserved for spectators not requiring lift-equipped transportation but who have a Disabled Person Parking placard, permit, or license plate for their vehicles. Wheelchairs will not be available for rent, but spectators may bring wheelchairs with them to the Championship.

To learn more about the accessibility services offered at the PGA Championship, click here.

To view a high resolution version of the onsite map, click here, or on the map below.

The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire

The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire is located by the Main Spectator Entrance. This merchandise shopping experience offers men's, women's, and children's apparel and headwear from major brands including Nike, Ralph Lauren, Adidas, Cutter & Buck, Under Armour, FootJoy, Peter Millar, Vineyard Vines, Ahead, 47 Brand, New Era, and many more! The PGA Shops also offer a major selection of exclusive accessories, gifts, and memorabilia.

Grand Opening Hours

Friday, May 10 - Sunday, May 12

9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Note: Parking is complimentary and located at Highview Baptist Church, 15201 Shelbyville Road, Louisville, KY 40245, please follow signage and traffic control to Lot D. Complimentary shuttle service will be provided to and from the Main Spectator Entrance at Valhalla Golf Club. There is no public parking at Valhalla Golf Club during the PGA Shops Grand Opening.

Championship Week Hours

Monday, May 13

8:00 AM - 7:30 PM

Tuesday, May 14 - Wednesday, May 15

7:30 AM - 7:30 PM

Thursday, May 16 - Friday, May 17

6:45 AM - 8:30 PM

Saturday, May 18 - Sunday, May 19

7:15 AM - 8:00 PM

On Location

On Location is proud to be the Official Travel Package Provider of the PGA of America. If you purchased your 2024 PGA Championship tickets or travel package through On Location and have any questions you can reach them by calling 800-591-9198.

For frequently asked questions visit www.onlocationexp.com/golf/the-pga-championship-faq or for information on future event experiences, please visit www.onlocationexp.com

Replica Wanamaker Trophy

Take a photo with a large-scale replica of the famed Wanamaker Trophy at the Main Spectator Entrance near The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire!

Official PGA Championship Programs

Official Programs are available for purchase in the PGA Shops.

PGA Partner Activations

Charles Schwab

Stop by the PGA Swing Analysis presented by Charles Schwab in the PGA Plaza on the 10th Fairway for a customized lesson from a PGA of America Golf Professional. Your online lesson will include a side-by- side comparison with a PGA Tour player along with tips and drills to help you improve your game. Come by for a free giveaway from Charles Schwab!

Corebridge Financial Team

The Corebridge Financial Team includes the PGA of America Golf Professionals from across the country who have earned their way to play on one of golf’s grandest stages, the PGA Championship. Corebridge Financial is dedicated to supporting PGA Golf Professionals on the golf course and helping them plan for retirement.

Chase Sapphire

Chase Sapphire cardmembers enjoy exclusive benefits on-course. When you make a purchase at the PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire, show your Reserve or Preferred card and get complimentary ground shipping or bag check to store your purchase.

Reserve cardmembers also get exclusive access to the Sapphire Reserve Lounge for yourself and a guest. Located near the 11th Green, the lounge includes premium cocktails, exclusive menu items, complimentary non-alcoholic beverages, a unique photo opportunity and free high-speed Wi-Fi. Capacity may be limited.

Elijah Craig Bourbon Speakeasy

Swing by the Elijah Craig Bourbon Speakeasy and discover the Greatness Within® award-winning Kentucky Bourbon at the 2024 PGA Championship at Valhalla. Grab a seat in this craft cocktail lounge and enjoy smooth whiskey libations, like the new and refreshing Elijah Craig Mulligan. Don’t forget to sign your name on the illustrious Signature Wall before you leave.

ESPN Bet Members Lounge

ESPN BET, an Official Betting Sponsor of the PGA Championship, has created an exclusive members lounge for ESPN BET users attending the Championship. Located at the 13th hole, the ESPN BET Members Lounge is a premium hospitality space available to ESPN BET account holders and those who sign up onsite. The lounge offers views of Valhalla's newly-renovated signature 13th green and includes a variety of amenities including drinks for purchase, covered seating, a VR simulator of the 13th hole, special ESPN BET offers for patrons onsite, and more.

High Noon Clubhouse

Don’t miss the High Noon Clubhouse located by the 8th Green and live your best day in the sun with High Noon at the PGA Championship! Grab an ice-cold premium hard seltzer from the High Noon Clubhouse Bar and commemorate the day at the photo station. You’ll also have a chance to score High Noon swag by landing a hole-in-one at putt putt or by trying your luck at the Plinko game. Sun’s Up!

Lexus

While onsite at the PGA Championship, make sure to check out the Official Vehicle, Lexus, at one of their three vehicle displays. You can check out their latest models, including the all new GX 550 Overtrail and first-ever TX 500h, near the main entrance, 8th Green, and 10th Fairway.

Michelob ULTRA Athletic Club

Tee off the fun at Michelob ULTRA’s Athletic Club during the PGA Championship. Located in PGA Plaza on the 10th fairway, guests can savor the competition with a cold Michelob ULTRA in hand. Attendees can make purchases at the ULTRA bar from a variety of ULTRA products. Guests can also take part in interactive games, customize complimentary coolies, and sip their favorite ULTRA beverage throughout the entire Championship.

Michelob ULTRA Greenside Viewing

Open to all spectators Monday through Wednesday, Michelob ULTRA Greenside provides premium views of the 18th Green. Enjoy a Michelob ULTRA or Michelob ULTRA Organic Seltzer in this shaded open-air venue which features a cash bar, seating and more. During Championship Rounds, a Michelob ULTRA Greenside Viewing badge will be required to access the venue.

T-Mobile Club Magenta

Prominently located on the 10th Tee Box and accessible to all PGA Championship ticket holders, Club Magenta guests will enjoy premium views of 10 Tee and 12 Green and a full lounge atmosphere to amplify their Championship experience. Spectators will get the opportunity to charge up with complimentary phone charging, show off their skills in a unique putting experience, and take in the day’s action with a full cash bar and non-stop Championship coverage. While everyone will have access, T-Mobile customers (and +1 guest!) can receive exclusive benefits including courtesy lawn chairs, T-Mobile merchandise, and a magenta cocktail (or mocktail!) during Magenta Hour. Club Magenta is open Monday, May 13 - Sunday, May 19, 2024 (Talent Drop-ins Wed-Sun)!

William Hill Wine Lounge

Looking for a way to enjoy a refreshing glass of wine without missing any of the golf? We’ve got you covered at the William Hill Wine Lounge. Located in PGA Plaza on the 10th fairway, guests can order from our well-crafted portfolio of William Hill wines while relaxing in our lounge area. Never miss a minute of the Championship from the comfort of the lounge complete with TV’s showing all the action. We will be here from the first tee time to the final tap in, so stop by and enjoy the Official Wine of the PGA Championship and PGA of America.

Monday, May 13

8:00 AM – 7:30 PM

Tuesday, May 14 – Wednesday, May 15

7:30 AM – 7:30 PM

Thursday, May 16 – Friday, May 17

6:45 AM – 8:30 PM

The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire Grand Opening

The PGA Shops presented by Chase Sapphire will be open to the general public, Friday. May 10 - Sunday, May 12. No ticket required.

Parking is complimentary and located at 15201 Shelbyville Road, Louisville, KY 40245, please follow signage and traffic control to Lot D. Complimentary shuttle service will be provided to and from the Main Spectator Entrance at Valhalla Golf Club. There is no public parking at Valhalla Golf Club during the PGA Shops Grand Opening.

Grand Opening Hours

Friday, May 10 - Sunday, May 12

9:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Practice Rounds

During the Practice Rounds, players are invited to play at their discretion. No advance starting times are available for the Practice Rounds. Groupings will be displayed course-wide on the Video Boards.

Monday - Wednesday, May 13 - 15

Playing Times*

7:00 AM – 7:30 PM

*On Wednesday, May 15, the 1st tee will close at 3:00 PM.

Championship Rounds

Starting times as listed are considered approximate, and are based on the assumption that there are no delays, inclement weather, etc.

Thursday - Friday, May 16 - 17

Starting on Holes #1 & #10 (groups of three)

Starting times:

7:15 AM - 2:57 PM*

First and Second round groupings and starting times will be announced no later than Tuesday, May 14.

Saturday - Sunday, May 18 - 19

All players starting on Hole #1 (groups of two*)

Starting times:

7:45 AM - 2:45 PM**

*Subject to change

** Saturday and Sunday times will not be finalized until Friday and Saturday evenings respectively

Wanamaker Trophy Presentation

The Wanamaker Trophy Presentation Ceremony will take place on the 18th Green immediately following the end of play on Sunday, May 19.

In the event of a tie for first place after 72 holes, there will be a three-hole aggregate score play-off on Holes 13, 17, and 18. If still tied, there will be a hole-by-hole play-off starting on Hole 18 and if still tied, Holes 13, 17, and 18 repeated. The Wanamaker Trophy Presentation Ceremony will occur immediately following the play-off.

Tickets and/or credentials, in the form provided by the Professional Golfers’ Association of America (“PGA”) or its subsidiary PGA Tournament Corporation, Inc. (“PTC”) will be required for admission into the Championship. All admission tickets issued by PGA or PTC granting access to the Championship are licenses that may be revoked by the PGA or PTC in their sole discretion for any reason or no reason at all. Please retain your ticket or credential at all times as security personnel will not allow admission into the event for individuals without appropriate credentials. Please do not tamper or interfere with the bar code presented on the ticket or credential. PGA/PTC is not responsible for lost or stolen tickets and/or credentials.

Re-Admission Policy

There will be no daily re-entry to the grounds. If you leave the grounds, you must have an unscanned ticket to return to the Championship. Once your ticket has been scanned, it will no longer provide admission. The only exception is when the Weather Warning signs have been posted.

Please click here for refund details: or, alternate day admission eligibility due to suspension of play, if applicable.

Junior Admission Policy

As part of the Championship’s mission to grow interest and participation in the game of golf, juniors 15 years of age and younger will be admitted into the Championship grounds for free when accompanied by a ticketed adult. Each ticketed adult will be permitted two junior grounds admissions per day at no additional charge. Junior tickets may be picked up on-site at the Ticket Office located at the Main Spectator Entrance on the day of admission.

Junior tickets cannot be obtained in advance and will be available regardless of a sell-out. Please note, junior tickets do not gain access into private hospitality areas or clubs and do not receive access to the Championship+ Inclusive Food & Non-Alcoholic Beverage Program.

Children under the age of 2 do not require an admission ticket to enter the Championship.

Military Admission Policy

To honor the men and women who serve our country in the Armed Forces, the Championship is pleased to offer Active Duty, Retirees*, Reserve, National Guard, and their accompanying guest (limit one) complimentary daily grounds access to the Championship.

Please click here to complete an online verification and request process with GovX, where a copy of a Military ID or service verification must be provided in exchange for daily admission. Following verification, military members will be directed to SeatGeek, to reserve their attendance. Please do this for each day you plan to attend.

Military Tickets are digital, and will appear in your SeatGeek ticket account on the morning of the event. The military member and guest must arrive together, with tickets on the same mobile device.

Please note, Military tickets cannot be upgraded to alternative venues, but are eligible for the junior admission policy. Further, Military tickets do not gain access into private hospitality areas or clubs and do not receive access to the Championship+ Inclusive Food & Non-Alcoholic Beverage Program.

Complimentary military tickets may be subject to availability based on event capacity. Thursday - Sunday military tickets are sold out.

*Career-retired with twenty years of qualifying military service and Department of Defense ID

Photo & Autograph Policy

Cameras are only allowed on-site during Practice Rounds, Monday through Wednesday, and are not permitted on-site during Championship Rounds, Thursday through Sunday. Please consult the Mobile Device Policy for guidelines regarding mobile device photo, audio, and video capturing while on-site.

We recommended limiting autograph requests to areas around the practice range and putting green during Practice Rounds only, Monday - Wednesday.

Mobile Device Policy

Mobile devices must be kept in Silent Mode Setting at all times at the PGA Championship:

Set your device to silent or vibrate, including but not limited to, ringer, notifications, and alerts.

Camera flash turned off.

Incoming and outgoing calls may only be made or received farther than 100 yards away from competition.

Text, email, social posting, and other data use is allowed on the golf course at any location, providing players are not in position and about to play their shots.

Mobile device photography, as well as audio and video capturing, is allowed in all areas during Practice Rounds (Monday-Wednesday).

During Championship Rounds (Thursday-Sunday), photography, audio, and video recording is prohibited anywhere within 100 yards of competition or when requested by players, caddies, marshalls, volunteers, security, or Championship staff and officials.

Alcohol Policy

All guests at the PGA Championship are asked to drink responsibly and be respectful of players and other members of the gallery. Spectators appearing under the age of 30 will be asked for identification before being allowed to purchase alcoholic beverages on-site.

The following documents are acceptable forms of identification at the PGA Championship:

Current, valid United States or Canadian Driver's License

Current, valid Military ID w/photo

Current, valid United States or Canadian ID card w/photo

Current, valid Passport

Current, valid Mexican Consular ID card

Current, valid U.S. or Canadian Passport Card w/photo

Temporary identification papers are not acceptable. There is a 2 alcoholic beverage limit, per person, per identification. Alcohol service will be discontinued at the discretion of management. You must be 21 years of age to purchase an alcoholic beverage. All alcohol sales will stop one hour before the gates close each day.

Smoking Policy

Smoking, to include, but not limited to, cigars, pipes, cigarettes, and e-cigarettes will be prohibited in any permanent or temporary buildings, inclusive of hospitality areas, on patios, decks or raised platforms and grandstands at the PGA Championship. Smoking is permitted on the grounds, 20 feet from any structures listed above.

Conduct Customs and Etiquette

Attendees are requested to display traditional customs of etiquette, decorum, and behavior, and to obey all Championship policies including, but not limited to, those provided on each ticket, all posted signs, and any instructions of Championship Marshals and Officials. Inappropriate behaviors and/or failure to comply with standards/policies may lead to ejection from the Championship and/or cancellation of admission tickets, without refund.

Although cheering and positive gallery responses to great play are encouraged, unsolicited and consistent calls from the gallery toward players and others are prohibited.

For the safety of everyone and in keeping with policy established at major sporting events, running is considered to be unacceptable behavior.

Please stay behind the gallery ropes and cooperate with instructions given by Championship Marshals.

Please kneel or sit if you are in the front row and remain still throughout each shot.

Anyone acting in a manner that is deemed to be abusive, derogatory, rude, or aggressive may be subject to removal from the Championship premises and may be prohibited from returning to the PGA Championship or attending any future PGA of America event.
